newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Hanoi to get tough with import-export tax dodgers.
newsitem.headline: Hanoi to get tough with import-export tax dodgers.

text.p: Vietnam said on Monday it would confiscate the assets of import-export companies that dodge taxes as part of a tightening of the communist country's chaotic revenue collection system.
A prime ministerial directive, carried in the official Nhan Dan newspaper, said goods and assets belonging to companies that failed to pay taxes would be seized and auctioned.
It said import licences would also be halted for firms that fail to meet their tax obligations.
Vietnam, one of the world's poorest countries, has been seeking to improve a loose tax collection system which in 1995 reached 91.3 percent of government targets.

Officials say problems with the collection of import taxes were a major factor in last year's budget deficit, which according to International Monetary Fund figures reached the equivalent of 1.7 percent of Gross Domestic Product.
New laws are expected to be announced following a national assembly session due later this year.
